div.pre: 2182 Cammarata, halfway between Hi- (193) mera and Acragas, 1859 Burial: early 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: c. 200 AR Selinus: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 10+ tetradr. (Agathocles, quadr. [3]; Nike type, coarse style but fdc [7]) Siculo-Punic: c. 30 tetradr. (Arethusa/ horse [1+]; Arethusa/horse hd. [7]; Heracles/horse hd. [c. 20]; female hd./ lion and palm-tree [2]) Rash Melcarth: 2 tetradr. Pegasi: c. 150 most melted down (incl. Anactorium,Argos) Disposition: parts to G. Romano and de Luynes (?) Romano, Sopra alcune monete scoverte in Sicilia (Paris, 1862), illus.
